storyInfo: Ferdinand reveals his will. Parvis reveals his madness. Even as he faces universal condemnation, Ferdinand stands his ground.

attributes.content: Once upon the land, there was no meaning in looking up.
There was nothing worth looking at up there, nothing worth exploring. That place was the domain of those who indulged in fantasies, those with their heads in the clouds.
But now, each and every person lifts their heads, looking up at the beam of light connecting heaven and earth.
Looking up at the once untouchable sky.
Among the stars, within the artificial constructs that appear so small before the torrent of light, brews the human ambition of this current epoch.
Kristen, Kristen...
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Sure enough, you set this plan into motion a long time ago. Everything you did for the DOD was a fancy show.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Hah! What's the principle behind all this? The efficiency and stability of this high-energy confinement field... I've never heard of anything like that before.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: If I recall correctly, you boasted that you were the foremost expert in high energy physics when you joined Rhine.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: ...One of the foremost experts.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: My God...
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You should thank your lucky stars, Saria, that there's nobody like Kristen in your field.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: It's just not fair. And yet she... she doesn't even bother to publish these results.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: The H.A.M.H.R.R. is currently charging.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: According to the military's Horizon Arc Project, once the charging phase is complete, all of this energy will be focused and undergo excitation a second time to deliver powerful wide-area strikes.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Sure. How much longer will it take?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Kristen turned the project dossiers into scrap paper... All I can say is, it won't be long now.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: This is our last chance to stop it.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: As well as our last chance to stop her.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: What are you still standing around slack-jawed for, Ferdinand? Time isn't on our side.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Saria, take a look at the densitometer over there.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: The needle seems to be fluctuating a lot.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: No, I'm not talking about the needle. The wobbling is a normal phenomenon of high-energy confinement fields. I'm talking about... the unit of measurement.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You can take a guess how many times larger this unit is than the one on the instruments in my lab.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: The energy it absorbed just now is enough to power every single one of Columbia's nomadic cities for at least six months.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And it's showing no signs of stopping.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And we're now in the center of the laboratory carrying this tremendous amount of energy.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Even if Nasti is a genius, she can't create a receptacle that stores energy in amounts beyond the realm of cognition.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: In other wordsâ€“
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: No matter what direction it ultimately focuses the energy in, once the second-degree excitation begins, this lab won't be safe from the consequences.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Her end goal has never changed.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: If her ultimate goal is the sky, and the sky can only be contested with this amount of energy...
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: What exactly is up there?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: That's none of my concern.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: All I know is, this is a reckless experiment.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: And it's doomed to fail.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Saria, there's nothing stopping you from packing your bags, finding a nice hillside with a great view, and enjoying a drink while you watch this fireworks show that may well go down in the annals of Columbian history.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: That isn't going to happen.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: What about you? You were never the risk-taking type.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Looks like my old friends are coming, and they'll be here sooner than expected.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You're right though. I'm not taking any chances. The technical manual has the location of the escape pod, and I know where it is.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I'm not particularly interested in seeing the one who fired me, and it's not like you need my help.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: An opportunity to document high energy physics phenomena of this magnitude is rare, and I don't intend to pass it up. Maybe you'll see a new paper from me in the journals next quarter.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I promise, it'll be era-defining.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Unlike Kristen, I don't tie all my intellect to my personal grievances.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: The fact that she's consigning all this knowledge to the grave, knowledge that could transform Terra's entire academic landscape... That's something I can't abide.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Do what you need to do, Saria. We don't have much time.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Stay safe.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Ferdinand.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: It's been a while, Colonel.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I'm not surprised you survived, but if I were in your shoes, I'd pretend to be dead.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Get the hell out of Dodge. Go to Victoria or Leithanien. With your skills, you can always pick up a teaching job.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: I didn't expect to hear those words coming from you.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Let me say this one more time, Ferdinand: It's over.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: I've already spoken with the Vice President. The DOD's defeat is absolute.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: As for whether or not this whole situation can be salvaged, or who controls my fate, I actually don't care that much anymore.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Let's save some dignity for each other, Ferdinand. Get out of here, and I'll save a crossbow bolt for myself.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Huh, what was that? Sorry, my mind wandered for a second there.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Also, you're blocking the radiometer display.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: This S.H.A.F.T. here runs a lot deeper than I expected...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I'm afraid the military simply failed to fully understand its structure.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Right here... is where the Transmitter's response is the strongest.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: What are you doing here, Silence?
Professor... Parvis...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Silence... The location of this lab is supposed to be top secret. How did you manage to find your way here?
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Silence tries hard to open her eyes wide, discerning the things in the room.
In the corner of the room, an instrument is humming as if breathing. A Transmitter sits in a transparent tank, bobbing up and down. Across the room are several books with black covers.
As if sensing Silence's presence, the Transmitter increases its activity. A strong wave of dizziness makes Silence furrow her brow and shake her head a few times.
Ah, that's right. You have your own Transmitter...
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Hmm, these reactive tendencies... You injected yourself with the Transmitter? Though, I'm not surprised.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Does it cause you occasional discomfort?
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: An entirely normal response. I also have it inside my body. It can be quite overwhelming for an old man like myself, but it shouldn't be a problem for you youths.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Still, this is the only way to better control the reaction process.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Don't worry. Once this experiment is over, the long-distance intertwining properties of this batch of Transmitter will be lost, and they won't affect the long-term health of the injected.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: What experiment? You're conducting an experiment here?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Silence, did you hurt your hand?
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Does it get in the way of your work?
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: I'm fine.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Then I won't ask any more questions. Now is the most critical moment.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: That you've found your way here... might just be the help I've needed.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: I was just complaining how much easier the data processing would be if you were here.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Lately, I... Actually, never mind.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Tell me, what kind of experiment are you running?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: There has only ever been one area of research I've fully dedicated my energy to.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: ...Chimerism.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Precisely. This is the last question to be answered in chimera research.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: But, this is...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Professor, what are all these documents? The text on them seems...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Quite 'evil,' right? This is an ancient Sarkaz tome that records the 'history' of a certain ethnic branch.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: That Sarkaz branch not only enjoys long lifespans, but can even transcend the shackles of physical form and exist in the world in a purely spiritual state.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: They have been dubbed, the 'revenants.' The pronunciation can be a bit esoteric, but I'm sure you'll be able to find some records in Victorian.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Silence, have you ever considered what chimerism does at the level of the soul?
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: A soul chimera?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: These 'revenants,' the so-called 'soul' in ancient Originium Arts and Sarkaz witchcraft, can they be produced a posteriori?
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Are you trying to create an artificial consciousness?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: You've always been my finest student.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: This is something I've been working on for decades, to little avail. That is, until Ferdinand told me that he and Dorothy had jointly produced this particular 'Transmitter.'
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: You can't begin to imagine how excited I was, Silence!
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: I was absolutely sure that the properties of the 'Transmitter'... were sufficient to form the soil from which artificial consciousness could be born.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: However, in this land, disturbances will always exist no matter how sophisticated the lab is. These disturbances have plagued me for the longest time...
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: There are so many possibilities. Perhaps the energy used to excite the Transmitter was insufficient, perhaps the laboratory was not sealed off enough, perhaps Originium interferes with the generation and aggregation of consciousness.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: But, none of that matters anymore. All mysteries will finally be unraveled today.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: This will be my final research project.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: The most optimal research environment is about to take shape.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Professor Parvis, you were responsible for using Transmitter to solve Arc-01's accuracy control problem. This is... the new Transmitter core.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Kristen wanted to do something she saw as taking a risk. She thought her work to be meaningful... I hate to be a critic of my peer's efforts, but let's be honest: we researchers have been cowards for far too long.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Mediocrity, boredom, risk-aversion, indecisiveness... Silence, those of us with the knowledge and ability have to do more than just 'explore' or 'progress.'
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: We carry science upon our shoulders, are commanded by it, are driven by it. It requires us to take on responsibilities that only a strong soul can endure.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: â€“â€“Usher in a new era.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: ...'Usher in a new era'?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Silence... You deserve to be here with me to witness this crowning achievement.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Soon, very soon now... the dark ages of mediocrity will come to an end, and the pantheon of science must return.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: You're shaking all over. I've rarely seen you like this.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Is that so? Perhaps the Transmitter's reaction is getting a bit too intense. Maybe I really am getting too old.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: I'm sure you can relate with me, Silence.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Yes, I can.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I can see you've really been looking forward to this moment.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Then, there's one thing I have to make clear. I will destroy this Transmitter core.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: I mean, I'm putting a stop to everything that's happening here.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Whether it's Control's plan or just your personal ambitions, all of this has to be reexamined.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: That's what I'm here for.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: That girl shook your allegiance to science, but I've always believed that you had the makings of a researcher.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: And as such, I never really blamed you.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: But this time, whether or not this is some ridiculous joke, I'm not going to stand for it.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: I'll have you apologize to me, Silence.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: I won't take back a single word I said, Professor.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I don't think I've done anything wrong, be it back then or now. What you people are really after is wanton power.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: That's absurd. You couldn't be more wrong, Silence.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: That's right. Say what you will about me craving power. Because I know what kind of research is important, and what kind of research can shape the future.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: What, are you going to regurgitate that old platitude about science belonging to the masses?
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: No!
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: Let me tell you, Silence, that science belongs to the Ãœbermenschen. The supermen.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: The mediocre can go elect their politicians and kiss the feet of their betters...
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: But only science is above their meddling.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: What about you then? Are you part of the 'Ãœbermenschen' you aspire to?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: ...That ship has already sailed for me.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: But if the consciousness I create is rational enough, grand enough, then it canâ€“â€“
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: It can't, Professor.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: If you don't even have faith in humanity, what makes you think that this nascent consciousness can supersede everything?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: You don't understand.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: You've poured your heart and soul into the field of chimeric research, attempting time after time to craft powerful creations through bioengineering. Is that all because...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: You can't run from your own weakness?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: ...Silence, I won't allow you to throw baseless speculation around like that.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: This is... my last hope to break free from mediocrity.
attributes.name: Parvis

attributes.content: ...I didn't expect to see you here.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: My former Defense colleagues.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: That's right, Director Saria. 'Former colleagues.'
We are now employees of Components Control Section.
'Components Control.'
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: You aren't allowed past this point.
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: You're doing a better job than last time.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: I appreciate the sentiment.
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: You all know what Kristen is trying to do. All this accomplishes isâ€“
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: I don't know, and I don't particularly care.
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: You know my ID number from Rhine, Saria.
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: 011. That was before Jara came. Kristen and I interviewed you, James.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Back then, I had offers from other companies, including Volvort Kochinski and Beachbrella. But, I didn't give them a second thought.
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: Because I always believed in you. You and Kristen. I believed you two were different from the rest of them.
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: That was just your ego speaking, James. This whole place is about to crash. I'd recommend you hurry up and grab an escape pod.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: I'll wait here until the moment we crash.
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: But before that, want to see something spectacular, Saria?
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: Nasti described it to us...
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: Saria notices the entire corridor shifting.
Is thatâ€”
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: I've never seen the land from this high up before.
attributes.name: Components Control Section Employee

attributes.content: The H.A.M.H.R.R. has begun altitude adjustment.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Out of the way! There's no time!
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Dammit, what's going on?! This blasted thing's spinning?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: If I had to guess, this would be the 'altitude adjustment' mentioned in the technical manual, which is the step right before secondary excitation.
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Sir, do you need my help?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Why are these doors in the corridor shut? Where's Ferdinand?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: He slipped away just nowâ€“
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier

attributes.content: Go after him!
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Are there no defense systems here other than the partition doors in the corridor?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: If I had any say in it, this place would be stuffed full of power armor.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Freeze, Ferdinand.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Got you.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: I need you to leave me alone, Colonel. Every minute here is precious.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And dealing with you would waste all my energy.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I thought we were peas in a pod, Ferdinand. Sober rationalists who would weigh the pros and cons before making a decision.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Looks like I had the wrong read on you.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Come with us.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: The beam excitation reading is 1.22. A constant should be introduced here to renormalize the entire formula...
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: What the hell are you talking about?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: I'm laughing at you, Blake.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I'm laughing at how pathetic you are. Your power, your medals, your rank in the DOD... You never lost sight of those.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: But now, we're standing at an altitude that few have ever touched, surrounded on all sides by scientific miracles. Just by reaching our hands out, we're on the cusp of plucking new formulae from these instruments.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Take a good look. Here, all the honors and accolades you've clung to are so small, so insignificant.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And what about your Rhine Lab, Ferdinand?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Haven't you been fixated on that?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Let me make a correction. I've been fixated on what Rhine Lab represents.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Rhine Lab is my toolbox. My ladder, my arm. But it is not my purpose.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: In case you've forgotten, I can proudly proclaim that I am one of the finest high energy physicists in the land... No, in both the land and the skies.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: What I've been fixated on has always been science itself.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Kristen, Kristen...
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: She created all of this, and let it go to waste. A truly prodigal genius she is.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And I envy herâ€“â€“
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: But I also have to admit, it's been an incredible ride.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: And so, each and every second of my time is insanely valuable, and I can't afford to waste a moment on you.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Listen to me, Ferdinand. Don't forget who you take orders from, and who gave you your new lease on life!
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Colonel, do you know how to stop a curious scientist?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You either satisfy him, or you kill him.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Get it over with. Don't waste time.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: One last thing I'd like to remind you of, soldiers.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: The H.A.M.H.R.R. will crash after reactivation, taking all of us with it.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: All this data might mean nothing to you, but... your lives, I trust, are very important.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: If you want to know where the escape pods are, you shouldn't be in such a hurry.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: As for you, Blake, I'd save an extra bolt... Either for yourself, or the one you answer to. Doesn't matter to me.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Just, don't break my instruments.
attributes.name: Ferdinand
